meanings.definition: A type of ancient Greek sculpture consisting of a head on a square pillar
meanings.sent1: In the museum, you can see a hermae depicting a head on a pillar.
meanings.sent2: The hermae in the park are fascinating examples of ancient Greek art.
meanings.sent3: The hermae in the exhibit seemed to be gossiping about the other sculptures.
meanings.sent4: The hermae stood tall like guardians of the ancient city.
meanings.sent5: The hermae's stern expression made it seem like it was watching over the square.

meanings.definition: A boundary marker or milestone in ancient Greece
meanings.sent1: The hermae along the road helped travelers know how far they had come.
meanings.sent2: Ancient Greeks used hermae to mark the borders of their land.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children painted funny faces on the hermae to confuse travelers.
meanings.sent4: The hermae stood like silent sentinels guarding the land.
meanings.sent5: The weathered hermae bore witness to the passage of time and travelers.

meanings.definition: A type of plant in the parsley family
meanings.sent1: The hermae plant in the garden has delicate white flowers.
meanings.sent2: Bees are attracted to the sweet nectar of the hermae flowers.
meanings.sent3: The hermae plant's leaves are so fragrant that they perfume the whole garden.
meanings.sent4: The hermae plant swayed gently in the breeze, a dance of nature.
meanings.sent5: The hermae plant's green leaves contrast beautifully with the white flowers.
